sentences.text: During a rebuild of all packages in sid, your package failed to build on amd64.
It may not be group or world writable.
The full build log is available from:
A list of current common problems and possible solutions is available at  http://wiki.debian.org/qa.debian.org/FTBFS .
About the archive rebuild: The rebuild was done on about 50 AMD64 nodes of the Grid'5000 platform, using a clean chroot.
Internet was not accessible from the build systems.
I have rebuilt the package under AMD64, using cowbuilder, and could not reproduce the failure.
Your report mentions some permission problems regarding /var/lib/sbuild - Can you verify whether it was a problem in your side?
The package is FTBFSing also in Ubuntu, with the very same error:
dpkg-buildpackage: error: fakeroot debian/rules binary gave error exit status 2
I'm using sbuild to build the package locally, on an AMD64 clean chroot, and I can post the full build log, if you want.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of ruby-image-science, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 652802@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Gunnar Wolf <gwolf@debian.org> (supplier of updated ruby-image-science package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
ruby-image-science - Clean Ruby library to provide simple transformations on images Closes: 652802
* Use a temporary directory for the Inline files used during the test.      Thanks to Christian Hofstaedtler for the insight! (Closes: #652802)
* Transitional packages should go to the "extra" section
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of ruby-parsetree, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 652802@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Gunnar Wolf <gwolf@debian.org> (supplier of updated ruby-parsetree package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
ruby-parsetree - Extract a class or method's parse tree, return it as a s-expressi Closes: 652802
* Fix FTBFS under sbuild because it does not provide a home directory      (Closes: #652802)
